com.ibm.avatar.api.tam

Class ModuleMetadataFactory

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.ibm.avatar.api.tam.ModuleMetadataFactory

  • public class ModuleMetadataFactory
extends Object
    This class provides APIs to load metadata of a module from the compiled AQL module file (i.e .tam file). There are APIs to load metadata for single and multiple modules from the given modulepath or classpath.
    See Also:
    ModuleMetadata

    • Method Detail

      • readMetaData

        public static ModuleMetadata readMetaData(String moduleName,
                                          String modulePath)
                                   throws TextAnalyticsException
        Loads the given module's metadata from the given module path, without instantiating the module.
        Parameters:
        moduleName - The name of the module whose metadata is to be loaded (without the .tam extension)
        modulePath - A list, separated by semi-colon (;), of URIs to directories or .jar/.zip archives where the compiled representation of module referenced in the moduleName parameter is to be found. Each entry in the list must be a fully qualified file:// or hdfs:// or gpfs:// URI. See Supported URI Formats for details.
        Returns:
        metadata of the given module
        Throws:
        TextAnalyticsException - Exceptions are thrown under the following circumstances:
        • If moduleName is null
        • If module is not found
        • If metadata cannot be deserialized properly

      • readMetaData

        public static ModuleMetadata[] readMetaData(String[] moduleNames,
                                            String modulePath)
                                     throws TextAnalyticsException
        Loads the metadata for the given set of modules from the given module path, without instantiating the module.
        Parameters:
        moduleNames - An array of names of modules whose metadata is to be loaded.
        modulePath - A list, separated by semicolons, of URIs to directories or .jar/.zip archives where the compiled representation of modules referenced in the moduleNames are to be found. Each entry in the list must be a fully qualified file:// or hdfs:// or gpfs:// URI. See Supported URI Formats for details.
        Returns:
        metadata of the given modules
        Throws:
        TextAnalyticsException - Exceptions are thrown under the following circumstances:
        • If moduleNames is null
        • If module is not found
        • If metadata cannot be deserialized properly

      • readMetaData

        public static ModuleMetadata readMetaData(String moduleName)
                                   throws TextAnalyticsException
        Returns the metadata of the given module, by locating the module file using the class loader as explained below. First, locate the module file using the current thread's context class loader; if the module is not found, locate using the current class loader. The metadata is loaded without instantiating the module.
        Parameters:
        moduleName - The name of the module whose metadata is to be loaded (without the .tam extension)
        Returns:
        metadata of the given module
        Throws:
        TextAnalyticsException - Exceptions are thrown under the following circumstances:
        • If moduleName is null
        • If module is not found
        • If metadata cannot be deserialized properly

      • readMetaData

        public static ModuleMetadata[] readMetaData(String[] moduleNames)
                                     throws TextAnalyticsException
        Returns the metadata of the given set of modules, by locating them using the class loader as explained below. First, locate using the current thread's context class loader; if the module is not found, locate using the current class loader. The metadata is loaded without instantiating the module.
        Parameters:
        moduleNames - An array of names of modules whose metadata is to be loaded.
        Returns:
        metadata of the given modules
        Throws:
        TextAnalyticsException - Exceptions are thrown under the following circumstances:
        • If moduleNames is null
        • If module is not found
        • If metadata cannot be deserialized properly

      • readAllMetaData

        public static ModuleMetadata[] readAllMetaData(String modulePath)
        Returns the metadata of all modules found in the given module path, without instantiating modules.
        Parameters:
        modulePath - A list, separated by semi-colons, of URIs to directories or .jar/.zip archives where the compiled representation of modules referenced in the input modules are to be found. Each entry in the list must be a fully qualified file:// URI. Currently, this API does not support hdfs:// URIs. See Supported URI Formats for details.
        Returns:
        An array of ModuleMetadata objects

      • readAllMetaData

        public static MultiModuleMetadata readAllMetaData(String[] moduleNames)
                                           throws Exception
        Returns the MultiModuleMetadata object formed from the modules listed in moduleNames. This object is formed using not only the modules in the module set, but all their dependent modules as well. The modules are looked for in the system classpath or the current threadâ€™s context classpath.
        Parameters:
        moduleNames - the modules for which to construct multi-module metadata around
        Returns:
        the multi-module metadata for the modules in the module set and their dependent modules
        Throws:
        Exception

      • readAllMetaData

        public static MultiModuleMetadata readAllMetaData(String[] moduleNames,
                                                  String modulePath)
                                           throws Exception
        Returns the MultiModuleMetadata object formed from the modules listed in moduleNames. This object is formed using not only the modules in the module set, but all their dependent modules as well. The modules are looked for in the module path specified in the input parameter modulePath.
        Parameters:
        moduleNames - the modules for which to construct multi-module metadata around
        Returns:
        the multi-module metadata for the modules in the module set and their dependent modules
        Throws:
        Exception

      • readAllMetaData

        public static MultiModuleMetadata readAllMetaData(String[] moduleNames,
                                                  String modulePath,
                                                  TreeMap<String,TAM> nameToTAM)
                                           throws Exception
        Returns the MultiModuleMetadata object formed from the modules listed in moduleNames. This object is formed using not only the modules in the module set, but all their dependent modules as well. The modules are looked for in the module path specified in the input parameter modulePath.
        Parameters:
        moduleNames - the modules for which to construct multi-module metadata around
        Returns:
        the multi-module metadata for the modules in the module set and their dependent modules
        Throws:
        Exception
